intro: Pteropyrum aucheri subsp. aucheri, commonly known as the Persian bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of the Middle East and Central Asia. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring upright stems and clusters of bell-shaped flowers. The flowers are usually blue to purple in color, with five petals that are reflexed at the tips. The plant has lance-shaped leaves that are arranged alternately along the stem, and it produces small, capsule-like fruits containing numerous seeds. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it a suitable choice for rock gardens and alpine settings.
